decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler. It also includes a mix of removal spells like Prismatic Ending and board wipes like Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats on the board. The deck's win conditions include powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer to close out the game while maintaining control over the board. Additionally, the mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining board control with efficient removal and tempo plays. By utilizing creatures like Solitude and Flickerwisp to exile threats and Ephemerate to flicker them for added value, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and finish them off with powerful creatures like Emperor of Bones and Quantum Riddler. With a mix of disruption, removal, and threats, this Death and Taxes deck seeks to outmaneuver and overpower the opponent in the Modern format.

The main focus of this Aggro Mono Black deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also pressuring the opponent with early-game creatures like Nethergoyf and Emperor of Bones. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command, while also utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga for card advantage and synergy with the Eldrazi creatures. The inclusion of a variety of land cards like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Prismatic Vista helps to ensure consistency in mana sources for the deck's aggressive gameplay.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and effects like Ruby Medallion, then using cards like Reckless Impulse and Wrenn's Resolve to draw cards and dig for combo pieces. The main win condition is to cast Past in Flames to cast multiple spells from the graveyard and eventually finish the game with a big Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes Wish cards to search for specific combo pieces when needed. Ral, Monsoon Mage provides additional card advantage and removal, while Artist's Talent can help disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures like Territorial Kavu and Scion of Draco, alongside removal spells like Lightning Bolt. Utilizing cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent's life total. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional protection and support for the aggressive strategy. The deck also includes some card draw and card advantage through Nulldrifter and Consign to Memory to keep the pressure on and maintain a strong board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Amulet of Vigor and land bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber to play Primeval Titan as early as possible. By using cards like Scapeshift, Urza's Saga, and Vesuva, the deck aims to create a powerful board presence with multiple Titan triggers. The deck also includes cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Gruul Turf to protect its combo pieces and maintain control over the game. Overall, the combo strategy revolves around quickly assembling the pieces needed to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature attacks.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Counterspell, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Solitude and Quantum Riddler. It combines removal spells like Fatal Push with powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also has some card advantage engines like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory to help maintain momentum and outvalue the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying consistent pressure to close out the game quickly.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through targeted removal and control elements while also accelerating its own clock with aggressive creatures. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, alongside versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Teferi, Time Raveler. By combining disruption with aggression, the deck aims to control the battlefield and force its opponent into unfavorable positions, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of efficient threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Birthing Ritual and other mana-boosting cards to play powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl. It also includes disruptive spells like Subtlety and Flare of Denial to control the opponent's board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and spells while maintaining control of the game with counterspells and removal. By combining aggression with control elements, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by cheap burn spells and cantrips to control the board and deal quick damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Slickshot Show-Off to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. The goal is to build a fast and efficient board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with targeted removal and quick damage bursts.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells like Past in Flames and Grapeshot to win the game. It includes cards like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, Manamorphose, and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate mana and draw cards. The deck also includes cards like Wish and Stormscale Scion to search for key pieces of the combo. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a storm of spells to win the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It also includes cards that enable token generation and a combo potential with Goblin Bombardment to deal additional damage. The deck emphasizes board presence and fast-paced gameplay, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures, burn spells, and tokens. Additionally, it includes cards like Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base and potentially take them off guard.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana through rituals and medallions to cast a large number of spells in one turn. Ral, Monsoon Mage is used to draw cards and deal damage to the opponent, while Past in Flames allows for the reuse of spells from the graveyard. Wrenn's Resolve protects key combo pieces, and Reckless Impulse helps with card selection. The deck also includes a Wish package for toolbox options and alternative win conditions like Grapeshot. Valakut Awakening provides card draw and potential mana fixing, while Glimpse the Impossible and Heroes' Hangout offer additional card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of artifact creatures and utilizing cheap artifacts to power out powerful threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary with powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the battlefield. With efficient card draw from cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast, as well as disruption tools like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt, the deck is able to maintain pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy with a mix of taxing effects and powerful creatures to control the opponent's board. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with cards like Solitude, Phage, and Ragavan. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Path to Exile to handle problematic threats. Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional disruption, while Elesh Norn and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer powerful win conditions. The mix of aggression and disruption makes it a versatile and challenging deck to face in 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to quickly generate mana with spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, then cast multiple spells in a turn to trigger Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability and deal massive damage with cards like Grapeshot. Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse help to draw into key combo pieces, while Past in Flames allows for recursion of those spells. The deck aims to create a fast-paced, explosive win condition by chaining together spells and overwhelming the opponent with damage in a single turn.
